Exaggerate: The claim "Danish study 'proves masks offer NO protection from COVID'" exaggerates the findings of the study, as the study did not conclude that masks provide no protection at all.
Understate: The claim understates the findings of the study by ignoring the fact that masks did offer some level of protection to wearers.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it misrepresents the actual findings of the study.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the study's results can be generalized to conclude that masks are useless for COVID-19, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that masks provide benefits to others by preventing the spread of the virus from wearers to others.
